Name: Mesa Verde National Park
Description: Mesa Verde National Park - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Ancient Pueblo cliff dwellings dating from 600 to 1300 CE, showcasing the culture of the Ancestral Pueblo people.

Name: Yellowstone National Park
Description: Yellowstone National Park - UNESCO World Heritage Site. First national park in the world, famous for its geysers, hot springs, and diverse wildlife.

Name: Everglades National Park
Description: Everglades National Park - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Largest subtropical wilderness in the United States, home to unique ecosystems and endangered species.

Name: Grand Canyon National Park
Description: Grand Canyon National Park - UNESCO World Heritage Site. One of the world's most spectacular gorges, carved by the Colorado River over millions of years.

Name: Independence Hall
Description: Independence Hall - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Birthplace of the United States, where the Declaration of Independence and Constitution were signed.

Name: Statue of Liberty
Description: Statue of Liberty - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Iconic symbol of freedom and democracy, gifted by France to the United States in 1886.

Name: Yosemite National Park
Description: Yosemite National Park - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Spectacular granite cliffs, waterfalls, and giant sequoia groves in the Sierra Nevada mountains.

Name: Chaco Culture National Historical Park
Description: Chaco Culture National Historical Park - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Major center of Ancestral Puebloan culture with impressive architecture from 850-1250 CE.

Name: Hawai'i Volcanoes National Park
Description: Hawai'i Volcanoes National Park - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Active volcanoes including Kīlauea and Mauna Loa, showcasing ongoing geological processes.

Name: Monticello and the University of Virginia
Description: Monticello and the University of Virginia - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Thomas Jefferson's neoclassical plantation home and his designed university campus.

Name: Taos Pueblo
Description: Taos Pueblo - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Ancient adobe pueblo continuously inhabited for over 1,000 years by the Taos people.

Name: Carlsbad Caverns National Park
Description: Carlsbad Caverns National Park - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Extensive cave system with spectacular limestone formations and bat colonies.

Name: Waterton-Glacier International Peace Park
Description: Waterton-Glacier International Peace Park - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Transboundary park combining Glacier National Park (US) and Waterton Lakes National Park (Canada).

Name: Papahānaumokuākea
Description: Papahānaumokuākea - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Remote marine and terrestrial ecosystem in the Northwestern Hawaiian Islands with cultural significance.

Name: Monumental Earthworks of Poverty Point
Description: Monumental Earthworks of Poverty Point - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Prehistoric earthworks built by hunter-gatherers between 1700 and 1100 BCE.

Name: San Antonio Missions
Description: San Antonio Missions - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Five Spanish colonial missions including the Alamo, showcasing Spanish mission architecture.

Name: The 20th-Century Architecture of Frank Lloyd Wright
Description: The 20th-Century Architecture of Frank Lloyd Wright - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Eight buildings showcasing Wright's organic architecture philosophy.

Name: Hopewell Ceremonial Earthworks
Description: Hopewell Ceremonial Earthworks - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Prehistoric earthworks built by the Hopewell culture between 200 BCE and 500 CE.
